Commentary: length and curving away deliciously in the corridor. Rahul nicely on the front foot to defend

short of a length at the hips. Nudged to short fine who looses his footing as he gets down for it. Manages to flap out and get his hands on it though. Dhawan alive to the the single on offer and calls confidently for it
full and swung way down leg side. Steps out and can't get close to that. Keeper has to parry that towards fine leg
short of a length outside off, punched into the covers off the back foot
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length and tailing in at the stumps. Dhawan steps out again. Forced to fend on the front foot. Gets an inside edge onto pad but they steal the run pitch side

neatly punched past point. Short of a length and shaping away just outside off. Just has a stab at this after allowing it to come close to him. Head on top of the ball, a last minute opening of the face and it beats third man comfortably to his right
122.7kph, length at off stump. Jabs at it from the crease, a bit too hard to get the single at mid-off
length at off stump, steps down the track and gets leg side of this. Punches firmly but straight to mid-off

dropped! Length ball floating into his pads. He flicks aerially. Dasun Shanaka is a couple of yards in from the boundary at deep square leg and takes some more inwards as this is hit towards him. Ends up having to leap to his left and tips it into the boundary
short of a length and just outside off, chopped to third man
oh glorious. A gentle outswinger in the corridor. In this form, that's a throwdown for Rahul. Nice stride out and a flowing drive to beat cover's left
and again. Length outside off, leans in and punches between cover and point again. That's 120kph wherabouts. It looked like they had put a sweeper out briefly, but clearly called him back in
full and hooping in at his pads. Gets it across the stumps and his head is in the off side as he looks to flick. Cops it on the front pad
slower ball sliding in at leg stump. Watchfully tucked to short fine's right with the angle. That was 111kph
slower length ball at middle stump. Pushes into the square leg region with soft hands
yorker dipping in furiously at off stump. Keeps the front leg inside the line to try and squeeze it through the covers. Can only jam it out to mid-on off the inside half of the toe
length and into him again. Steps out and has a flick at yet another one. Cops it on the pad again. Deflected down to third man
full offcutter on leg stump. Clipped to midwicket's right with soft hands
full at off stump, gets forward and flicks to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: DM de Silva to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: drilled over mid-on. Length ball pushed through outside off, lots of room to swing through the line. No turn. Reaches out and nails the connection on it
Commentary_short: DM de Silva to Dhawan, FOUR runs

Commentary: tossed up at off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
Commentary_short: DM de Silva to Dhawan, 1 run

Commentary: length and just outside off, punched straight to extra cover. That skidded on quickly
Commentary_short: DM de Silva to Rahul, no run

Commentary: nonchalantly whipped over the long leg boundary. Quick full toss on leg stump. Gets on one knee and just helps it along from underneath. Quick hands, quick bat speed
Commentary_short: DM de Silva to Rahul, SIX runs

Commentary: full on off stump, driven to mid-off's left
Commentary_short: DM de Silva to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: slower ball, short of a length at the hips. Lets that come on and glances late to short fine's left. Deep square sprints to his right to clean up
short of a length on leg stump, whipped out to deep square off the back foot
edged and past the keeper. Full and into the corridor. Stays leg side of it and has a drive at it. Thick edge through where first slip would have been
offcutter at a length, just outside off. Opens the face and runs it to third man
slower short ball at off. Adjusts for the pace, punches firmly to sweeper cover
top skill. Stands his ground this time, no stepping out. Length ball into him from around the wicket. Lets that come on and uses the angle to clip this aerially, but safely wide of mid-on
short of a length on leg stump, clipped to deep square off the back foot
just helps it along. Wide of the crease, short and across Dhawan. Uses the pace and the angle to cut wide of third man
what a sight. Pure class from Dhawan. Once again, uses the angle. This one is full and just outside off. Half a stride down and opens the face to drive this through extra cover
short outside off, looks to cut and gets an under-edge to third man
short of a length and hurrying him in the corridor. 142kph. Mistimed punch to point
direct hit at the non-strikers, sent upstairs. Full at the stumps, driven to mid-on off the low part of the bat. But he's well in
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
length ball, looped slow and wide outside off. Reaches out and drives to sweeper's left
another attempted slower ball. At a length and very wide. Left alone

an effort in vain at third man. Length ball pushed across him. Gets low and drives square. Third man makes the ground, puts in a slide to his left and reaches the ball. But gets tangled up as he lands on the turf and it slips through
short of a length outside off, steps out and under-edges the cut to point
slower short ball outside off. Cut straight to point
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Punched to sweeper cover
past the outside edge. Length on off, gets forward and plays for the legbreak. This slides straight on
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Dhawan, no run

Commentary: full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Dhawan, 1 run

Commentary: short of a length at middle stump, whipped to long-on off the back foot
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: nicley slowed down. Tosses this just short of a length on leg stump. Leans in and is forced to flick this to short fine
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Dhawan, no run

Commentary: length on leg stump, pushed to deep midwicket off the back foot
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Dhawan, 1 run

Commentary: length outside off, gets forward and drives to sweeper cover
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: short outside off, pulled firmly back down the pitch. Bursts through Sandakan's hands
short of a length and just outside off. Slowed right down. Punched to sweeper cover
again, very good pace on this. 82.4kph and dipping at a length on middle. The openers are happy to suss the spinners out right now. Watchfully poked to deep midwicket
beaten on the reverse whip as this arrives much later than he expects. A length ball outside off and he cops it on the pad, outside the line of off
short of a length on middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
dropped short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket

smoked over deep midwicket! This was on the cards. Hasaranga pushes this at a length wide outside off, sliding on nicely and he makes a lot of swinging room with the front leg in the leg side. A brute of a slog sweep
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Dhawan, SIX runs

Commentary: tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Dhawan, 1 run

Commentary: googly, full at middle stump. Flicked with the turn to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: length and slowed down at an off stump line. Leans in for the flick but ends up pushing it towards the bowler
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Dhawan, no run

Commentary: short of a length googly outside off. Steps out and check-punches to long-off
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Dhawan, 1 run

Commentary: googly, loopy and at a length on leg stump. Leans in and flicks to deep square
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: googly outside off, inside edges the sweep to short fine leg
tossed up on the off stump, driven crisply through extra cover to raise fifty for Shikhar Dhawan. Superb knock, having come into this game under pressure to score runs
tossed up on middle, swept along the ground to deep square leg
top edges the reverse sweep, but he had picked his shot wisely because there was no third man, so it landed safely. Dhawan set himself up for the reverse hit early

swept hard but straight to deep midwicket. Dhawan was looking good after initial jitters, so he'll be unhappy with that. Struck the sweep well enough, but didn't place it well. Tossed up on off, didn't quite get it off the middle, more towards the end of the bat and Sri Lanka have a breakthrough
Dismissal_text: S Dhawan c Gunathilaka b Sandakan 52 (36b 7x4 1x6) SR: 144.44

Commentary: first ball six!. He leaned into the off-drive and seemed to have not hit it very hard, but he finished with a flourish and the ball carried all the way over long-off
drags it down short, but it keeps a bit low. Rahul goes back and across and uses his wrists to whip through midwicket
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Rahul, 2 runs

Commentary: fired in on the pads, worked to long-on's right
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: plumb in front and Samson won't review. He's walking off. Googly on a length outside off, and he didn't read it at all, played down the wrong line. The ball strikes pad, in line with off. That was hitting the stumps. Six and out for Samson.
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Samson, OUT
Dismissal_text: SV Samson lbw b PWH de Silva 6 (2b 0x4 1x6) SR: 300.00

Commentary: tossed up full on off, driven on the front foot to long-off
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: drags it down short and Rahul pounces. Rocks back and pulls this from low down, hard and in control, through midwicket
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Rahul, FOUR runs

Commentary: good length, floated up on off, he takes a big stride to meet it and strokes it through cover
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: superb placement and great effort by the man running to his left from square leg. Rahul spotted this one full and swept it fine. Didn't get a boundary but will raise a fine fifty.
smoked. Low full toss on off and he absolutely uncorked on it. Pandey had to duck quickly because otherwise it would have taken his head off. Straight into the boundary

beautifully bowled and I think Rahul's in trouble here. And yes, he's not got his foot back in time, so he'll be out stumped. Nicely tossed up googly, that dragged him forward to drive. Was bowled wider of off too, and Rahul beaten all ends up, cannot connect. The bails are off in a flash and he didn't have enough time to drag his back foot back over the line
Dismissal_text: KL Rahul st †Perera b Sandakan 54 (36b 5x4 1x6) SR: 150.00

Commentary: another googly, but wide of off and spinning away, gives Iyer the room to go on the back foot and cut this through point

another one goes down! India are crumbling after a rollicking start. Wristspin winning the day. Sandakan once again follows a bad ball with a very good one, slows it through the air and bowls with an enticing loop. Iyer is looking to punch down the ground, way too early into the shot and ends up popping it back for the easiest of return catches.
Dismissal_text: SS Iyer c & b Sandakan 4 (2b 1x4 0x6) SR: 200.00

Commentary: tossed up outside off, fuller length, driven to long-off on the front foot. Came off the toe end
back of a length coming into him, defended on the back foot
back of a length nipping into him again, goes across and tucks it softly through midwicket. Wants two but Pandey calls a loud no
delicately done. Back of a length in the corridor, he just brings his bat down late to late cut it past the lone slip
length ball nibbling around off, tapped to the bowler's right
fuller on the stumps, flicked off his pads to wide long-on
too full outside off and a nice sound as Pandey cracks this through extra cover, giving himself a bit of room
pushed this through across him on a length and it slides past Kohli's attempted cut
too short and punished. Kohli saw the length, went deep in his crease and uncorked a fierce pull between long-on and midwicket
top edge lands safe, well in front of deep square leg. Another one dropped short, but this one had more loop on it and he got a top edge while going back to pull
full on middle, driven to long-on
length ball on leg stump, tapped gently to short fine leg
googly skids on and almost has him. But Pandey's penchant for playing late saved him. He hadn't read it but jabbed his bat down in time to get an inside edge onto pad
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Pandey, no run

Commentary: short and he swats a pull to deep midwicket. There's protection there
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: length outside off, slashes a cut straight to point
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Kohli, no run

Commentary: tossed up on the stumps, draws Kohli forward and he can only work it off his toes to long-on
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Kohli, 1 run

Commentary: hint of room and he transfers weight back to cut this past point
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Pandey, 2 runs

Commentary: googly on a length skids on, chopped to backward point
Commentary_short: PWH de Silva to Pandey, no run

Commentary: length ball on the stumps, Kohli works it to midwicket on the front foot with soft hands. Man is deep so they get two

bang. As good a straight drive as you'll see, doesn't matter if he's at 3 or 6. Big stride out to convert this length ball into a fuller one and unleashes a drive with the full face of the bat, sending it all the way over the bowler's head
fuller on the pads, flicked to midwicket
gets this to swerve into the batsman on a yorker length, he jams his bat down to send it to mid-on's right
Kohli special bottom hand whip. Full toss on the pads and those powerful wrists come into play, as does his spatial awareness of where the fielders are to pick the gap behind square perfectly

fuller on the stumps, he walks across and flicks this to the same area as the last ball, but this wasn't hit as powerfully so it allows the man at deep square leg to run to his right and put in a sliding stop
dismissed. Too short and Pandey clears his front leg to swat a pull shot to the midwicket boundary
full on off, he goes deep in his crease and drives it to long-on's right. The fielder moved quickly and was in position to field

suicidal second and Kohli's gone. He was looking supremely in command but there was no need to go for that run when there wasn't one and Kohli is run out by a long way. Fuller on the stumps, he flicked it to deep square leg. There was a fielder there. Kohli was charging down for the second, probably took even Pandey by surprise. The throw was accurate and Kohli is gone
upper cuts it straight to third man. digs it in short outside off, Sundar makes decent connection but that's poor placement and third man gobbles it up
Dismissal_text: Washington Sundar c Sandakan b Kumara 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

Commentary: short ball on off, he stays beside it and chops it to third man
he ducks under the bouncer and that's been given a wide. No country for bowlers, is T20 cricket. That was a borderline call. On another day, that would have been a fine bouncer to end the over with.
fuller on off, punched to mid-off
slam. That's been dealt with disdainfully. Slower short ball outside off and he just unleashes a baseball style swat over midwicket
fuller on off, he goes for  a big swipe over cover, gets a leading edge that swirls over mid-off and lands safe
lovely shot, goes deep in his crease and drives it straight, showing the full face of the bat. Long on and long off both converging on it and they manage to stop the boundary
shot. Manish Pandey's showing his class. He's going very deep, and that allows him to take advantage of this slightly shorter and wider one, cuts it beautifully through backward point
gives the bowler the charge but Malinga keeps his length shorter, so Pandey can only flat bat it to long-off
yorker on off, but bowled at slower pace. Shardul's dealt with it comfortably enough, using wrists to flick to deep midwicket. Only a single though, so he'll still be on strike
gives himself room and comes down the track, hits this full ball hard and straight down the ground, but can't beat long-on running to his left and tumbling to save
whoa, that's some hit. Length ball on off, he was clearing his front foot and hit a punch on the up almost. But hit it so well that it just kept flying and went over the straight boundary
Kumara's bowling the same length and Shardul just gives himself room and swats it nonchalantly over extra cover. He's not letting India feel the absence of Kohli
full toss on the stumps, bunts it to mid-off
boom. Pandey's putting on a mini masterclass. That was a super shot. Dug in short, he transfers weight back and rockets it to the midwicket boundary.
good ball to finish but dealt with well. Yorker on the stumps, but Pandey goes deep again and punches it straight. They sprint between the wickets to get two and go over 200
length on leg stump, flicked down to fine leg. No swing on that
short and wide outside off, just a little too much steepness on that and he's beaten on the cut
Commentary_short: Bumrah to WIA Fernando, no run

Commentary: short of a length and just outside off. Stays leg side of it and looks to steer this between point and cover. Can't beat Iyer to his left
Commentary_short: Bumrah to WIA Fernando, no run

Commentary: just clears mid-on. Short of a length and just outside off. Looks pull off the front foot and gets it off the toe end of the bat
length on leg stump, mistimed punch towards mid-on, allows him a single with a quick call
yorker down leg side, can't get bat on that

dragged straight to mid-on. Poor position for the pull short. This is 141kph, short and rising across him. Feet are rooted, there's no pivot as he makes the connection and he's just too far away from the ball to get it off the middle. Sundar has time to get side on and watch it into his hands
Dismissal_text: MD Gunathilaka c Washington Sundar b Bumrah 1 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00

Commentary: short of a length and swung away just outside off, punched to point off the back foot
Commentary_short: Thakur to WIA Fernando, no run

Commentary: smoked it! Wow. That is a sweet connection. Short of a length on middle stump, absolutely minimal feet on this, but a clean swing across the line to get this slug over the midwicket boundary
Commentary_short: Thakur to WIA Fernando, SIX runs

Commentary: steered to cover. The same static feet that allowed him room for the previous shot have cost him this time. Short of a length, rising and moving away outside off. Has to reach out and slice at this on the rise. Finds Iyer with precision
Dismissal_text: WIA Fernando c Iyer b Thakur 9 (7b 0x4 1x6) SR: 128.57

Commentary: length and swung away in the corridor. Defended cautiously in slip's direction
Commentary_short: Thakur to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: beaten. Has a stab at that outswinger. Doesn't look like he knew what was happening there. It curved away from a length outside off, he chased with his hands
Commentary_short: Thakur to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: more nervous prodding. Short of a length and hooping away from him. Thinks of the cut, thinks of withdrawing. Just caught in the middle by the end as this sails through to the keeper
Commentary_short: Thakur to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: full and very wide outside off, left alone
lifts it past the outside edge. Short of a length and some late swing away from middle and off. Skips and has a poke at this
length, marginal late movement away in the corridor. Feet rooted to the crease as he stabs this into the covers
beaten on the hoick. 141.7kph. Short and just outside off. Jumps into the leg side and is too late to connect on that swipe
looks to flick but that ends up rolling towards mid-off. Short of a length and across him. Comes on too quick for him to even manage to close the face. It's off the outside half of the bat
length and swung in at leg stump. Stays tall and flicks. Sundar sprints to his right and gets his body behind this to stop
mean bouncer. It's tough going for Oshada so far. But does well to sway away from this. 141.5kph and lifting dangerously towards the throat. Lets it go
Commentary_short: Saini to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: appeal for lbw while Pandey swoops in from point to take the stumps out. It's a full toss on leg stump, Perera is rapped on the pad as he looks to flick. Doesn't look a bad shout that. In the meantime, he's run down the pitch, possibly doesn't know where the ball is. Oshada doesn't want it but reluctantly goes in the end. Pandey sprints to the stumps and completes the run out
length ball outside off, swings away late. Left alone
short of a length and swung away outside off. Left alone
length at off stump, anxiously pushed into the covers as this squares him up a tad
short and wide outside off. Looks for the cut but gets an under-edge into the covers
a maiden. Length and swinging away outside off. Has a swish at that with feet rooted to the crease, can only get it as far as Pandey at point
mistimed pull lands safely between mid-on and mid-off. Short of a length at off stump. Slices it off the high part of the bat
short of a length just outside off, pushed to cover's left from the crease
connects sweetly on this! Overpitched and just outside off. Lots of room and he uses it to shovel it over mid-on
slower short ball at leg stump. Looks to pull but is through it too quickly. Trickles out to midwicket
short of a length on leg stump, punched to mid-on's right off the back foot
hammered to the midwicket boundary. Short at a middle stump line. Mathews is already down the pitch and into the leg side so he was both room and momentum. Gets his weight into that front foot pull

a repeat against the left-handers! Yorker speared in at middle stump. Perera backs into the leg side and looks to jam his bat down at this. He's got it down alright but down the wrong line. This is past his inside edge and crashes into the stumps, much like the wicket last match of Gunathilaka
short and wide outside off, left alone
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, 1 wide

Commentary: shot! Elegant from DDS. Short of a length and just outside off, quickly onto the back foot which jumps into the off side, connects right under his eyes and opens the face late to get this past point
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, FOUR runs

Commentary: short of a length and just outside off, defended into the covers
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, no run

Commentary: short of a length and just outside off. Another glorious punch off the back foot but can't beat Pandey at point, who feels the sting of this
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, no run

Commentary: length at off, defended into the covers
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, no run

Commentary: class. Three of the most elegant shots this over from this man. Short and getting up at off stump. He's quickly on his toes to get on top of the bounce of this, hooks into the turf and through midwicket. Just the perfect technique on that
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, FOUR runs

Commentary: length on middle stump, nudged to deep backward square off the front foot
length on middle stump, tapped into the leg side off the back foot
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to DM de Silva, no run

Commentary: short of a length at middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to DM de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: length at the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Mathews, no run

Commentary: short of a length at leg, tucked to midwicket off the back foot
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Mathews, no run

Commentary: short at off stump, shuffles and drops this in the square leg region with soft hands. Too much running for Chahal from deep midwicket to stop the second
whistled past past point. Dropped short and turning away from off stump. Deep in the crease and chopped confidently
Commentary_short: Chahal to DM de Silva, FOUR runs

Commentary: length on middle, punched to sweeper with the turn
Commentary_short: Chahal to DM de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: length on middle stump, clipped into the leg side from deep in the crease
short of a length and sliding on at off stump. Punched to sweeper cover
Commentary_short: Chahal to DM de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: length on middle stump, leans in and jabs it in long-on's direction. Chahal chases, slides, and throws it back in quickly to his right
short of a length outside off, backs away and punches to sweeper
Commentary_short: Chahal to DM de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: beats the inside edge and off stump. Short of a length and turning in from outsie off. Skids low and deflects to short fine off Samson
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to DM de Silva, 1 bye

Commentary: clean hit. Length, flat, sliding on at middle. In this format, that's an invitation for the slog sweep. Mathews takes it with front leg well in the leg side
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Mathews, SIX runs

Commentary: short of a length and turning into off stump. Carved to cover's left off the back foot
thick outside edge. Short of a length and sliding through in the corridor. Backs away and wants to punch this to sweeper's right. Ends up finding the third man boundary
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to DM de Silva, FOUR runs

Commentary: short of a length outside off, shuffles and clips to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to DM de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: and now over long-on! Another rather friendly delivery. Flat and at a length, just outside off. Gets the stride down the pitch and drills it flat over the fielder
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Mathews, SIX runs

Commentary: incredible shot! Length ball turning away outside off. Jumps into the leg side and does superbly to launch this on the up and wide of long-off, where Pandey is leaping in vain
Commentary_short: Chahal to DM de Silva, SIX runs

Commentary: length on leg stump, cops it on the pad as he looks to flick
Commentary_short: Chahal to DM de Silva, no run

Commentary: length at leg stump, backs away to try and go over the covers again. Drags it to long-on off the toe-end
Commentary_short: Chahal to DM de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: short of a length on middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
short at middle stump, punched aerially over the bowler, off the back foot. Long-on cleans up to his left
Commentary_short: Chahal to DM de Silva, 2 runs

Commentary: short of a length on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket off the back foot
Commentary_short: Chahal to DM de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: lifted clean over mid-off. Full toss outside off, clears his front leg and punches it over mid-off
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, FOUR runs

Commentary: good length outside off, punched to cover
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, no run

Commentary: low full toss on off, whipped to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: length on the stumps, he thought it was shorter than it was and was shaping to pull, but adjusted well to play a checked sweep shot to fine leg
skilfully done. Length ball outside off, and he opens the face of the bat to run it very fine. Third man puts in a despairing dive but can't stop the ball hitting the boundary
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, FOUR runs

Commentary: good comeback, pinpoint yorker on the stumps that he can only defend back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, no run

Commentary: whoa. That's an incredible shot. Flat-batted sweep shot that goes over wide long-on for six. No fielder would have had a chance. The bowler's not giving himself much of a chance by bowling so full either
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Mathews, SIX runs

Commentary: caught by Pandey at long-on. Washington invited the big shot again, but this time he floated it up well wide of off, making Mathews fetch the flat-batted sweep. He gets it off the toe-end. Pandey's at long-on, has to run to his left, but he's not going to drop any ball that's in the air near him
Dismissal_text: AD Mathews c Pandey b Washington Sundar 31 (20b 1x4 3x6) SR: 155.00

Commentary: chopped to point
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to DM de Silva, no run

Commentary: given some air, bowling on a seventh stump line, he goes across and works it through midwicket
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to DM de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: too short, outside off, punched to mid-off
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Shanaka, no run

Commentary: fuller on the stumps, worked through midwicket
flatter on off, turned around the corner to short fine leg

almost a brilliant save by Pandey at long-on, but while running to his left and trying to tap the ball in, he's touched the advertising boards so that's a four. Good shot by Dhananjaya, who went back and punched straight, going over the bowler
Commentary_short: Chahal to DM de Silva, FOUR runs

Commentary: carved through cover
Commentary_short: Chahal to DM de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: tossed up on a length outside off, drawing him on the front foot. He gets to the pitch and taps it back to the bowler
drags it down short, and he goes deep in his crease to pull this from the fifth stump over long-on. Fiercely hit
straightens his line to bowl on the stumps. Not getting much turn though - perhaps the dew effect - and is worked through midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched to the bowler's left
good bouncer, sharp and too quick for him and he can't connect. He went for the hook while swivelling, and that took his head out of the trajectory of the ball. that was a well targetted bouncer.
goes wide of off stump and he'll have to rebowl that. Tight call, that perhaps started within the tram-lines and swung away
soft dismissal. Digs it in back of a length, and Shanaka thinks he has the room to pull this, but is late on the shot. Ends up popping the easiest of catches back to the bowler
Dismissal_text: MD Shanaka c & b Thakur 9 (9b 0x4 1x6) SR: 100.00

Commentary: length in the corridor, defended into the offside
Commentary_short: Thakur to PWH de Silva, no run

Commentary: direct hit by Chahal at mid-off. This was a yorker gone wrong, ends up as a low full toss. Punched forcefully to mid-off and that is some casual, casual running between the wickets. He was just ambling. Chahal was at mid-off, the ball came straight to him and he released it quickly, finding the stumps with the batsman well short.
Commentary_short: Thakur to PWH de Silva, OUT
Dismissal_text: PWH de Silva run out (Chahal) 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

Commentary: full and wide outside off, squeezed out to third man
Commentary_short: Thakur to DM de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: length ball well outside off, he goes across and works it through midwicket
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to DM de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: length on a fifth stump line, he comes forward and defends gently to cover. Hit softly enough that they can take a single
flatter an quicker outside off, but also shorter. Allows Dhananjaya to slap a pull shot to deep square leg and reach fifty. Superb counter-attacking innings, but lacking support
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to DM de Silva, 2 runs

Commentary: sweeps it from near his knee roll to deep square leg
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to DM de Silva, 2 runs

Commentary: gives himself room and carves this inside out over cover
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to DM de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: beaten completely and stumped. danced down the track but Washington bowled it straight and wide of off. The batsman went for an almighty swing, but connected only with air. Straightforward stumping for Samson
Dismissal_text: PADLR Sandakan st †Samson b Washington Sundar 1 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00

Commentary: digs it in short outside off. Dhananjaya goes for the pull but can't beat midwicket in the circle
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, no run

Commentary: super shot. That was a good ball, yorker on the stumps. Dhananjaya walked across and was almost falling over as he flicked it off his toes. Managed to pick the gap at square leg perfectly while doing that
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, FOUR runs

Commentary: caught at third man. Sri Lanka's last bit of resistance has ended. Good short ball by Sainia, outside off. Dhananjaya wanted to slap it over point, but ends up not middling it and slicing it straight to third man. Was at an awkward height to play that shot
Commentary_short: Saini to DM de Silva, OUT
Dismissal_text: DM de Silva c Bumrah b Saini 57 (36b 8x4 1x6) SR: 158.33

Commentary: low full toss on off, he was clearing his leg to crash it through the offside, gets a thick edge to third man

spoons a catch to mid-off and India have won the series 2-0. Another short ball, too well directed for a tailender and too quick also. Malinga wanted to thwack that over cow corner, gets it high on the bat because he's too slow on it and it goes off the toe-end to the fielder there, who happens to be Kohli.
Dismissal_text: SL Malinga c Kohli b Saini 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
